post.body_html: I use both websites, but I try to visit and spend more time on Ruqqus
post.title: Do you still use Reddit alongside Ruqqus?

body:
Unfortunately yes because Ruqqus isn't popular enough. Though I don't visit Reddit for casual use. I use it for productivity & information resource subreddits. Many guilds exist but it's not exactly helpful when they're tiny and inactive. Until the crowd effect takes off on Ruqqus, I'll be stuck with Reddit.

I do use some extensions to keep myself as private as possible on Reddit and to block a lot of Reddit. For instance, I browse Reddit either in a private window or in its on separate Firefox container so that Reddit doesn't track me after I leave their shitty site.

I also use Leechblock to basically block the front page and a list of shitty subreddits. I started with a Leechblock template that I found at reddit.com/r/distractionfree  and customized it to my preference. I use the Leechblock settings to navigate to the subreddits I still use directly without having to deal with the rest of Reddit
body_html:
Unfortunately yes because Ruqqus isn't popular enough. Though I don't visit Reddit for casual use. I use it for productivity & information resource subreddits. Many guilds exist but it's not exactly helpful when they're tiny and inactive. Until the crowd effect takes off on Ruqqus, I'll be stuck with Reddit.

I do use some extensions to keep myself as private as possible on Reddit and to block a lot of Reddit. For instance, I browse Reddit either in a private window or in its on separate Firefox container so that Reddit doesn't track me after I leave their shitty site.

I also use Leechblock to basically block the front page and a list of shitty subreddits. I started with a Leechblock template that I found at reddit.com/r/distractionfree and customized it to my preference. I use the Leechblock settings to navigate to the subreddits I still use directly without having to deal with the rest of Reddit

body:
There are a few niche subreddits I still check for info on certain topics, but I'm largely moving away.

If you look at Reddit's all/popular feeds these days, it's mostly just left-wing politics. The relentless politicisation of every subreddit really killed the site for me. If it's not about politics, it's been upvoted because the subject is a girl, is black, or is wearing a mask. Most of the actual content is trash which people only upvote for the sake of virtue signalling, it's like a parody. Circlejerking was always a problem on Reddit, and likely will be on Ruqqus too, but the abusive moderation and admin intervention which suppresses anyone who steps out of line really has done a number on Reddit.
body_html:
There are a few niche subreddits I still check for info on certain topics, but I'm largely moving away.

If you look at Reddit's all/popular feeds these days, it's mostly just left-wing politics. The relentless politicisation of every subreddit really killed the site for me. If it's not about politics, it's been upvoted because the subject is a girl, is black, or is wearing a mask. Most of the actual content is trash which people only upvote for the sake of virtue signalling, it's like a parody. Circlejerking was always a problem on Reddit, and likely will be on Ruqqus too, but the abusive moderation and admin intervention which suppresses anyone who steps out of line really has done a number on Reddit.

body:
It is more extreme even than just "left wing politics." My personal last straw was being down-voted into oblivion because I vaguely implied that am a fucking omnivore, within a subreddit not even remotely associated with veganism.  

My crime was stating I spoil my dairy goats rotten, and I got hateful replies of "But the bahhhbies!!!!! Oh, the cruelty!!!"  I never replied, but I am not actually eating an animal I can then sell for $500. I am not morally opposed as an omnivore, but I am also not fucking stupid when I could be having pocket money instead of a goat chop.

I am done for good.

parent.body:
There are a few niche subreddits I still check for info on certain topics, but I'm largely moving away.

If you look at Reddit's all/popular feeds these days, it's mostly just left-wing politics. The relentless politicisation of every subreddit really killed the site for me. If it's not about politics, it's been upvoted because the subject is a girl, is black, or is wearing a mask. Most of the actual content is trash which people only upvote for the sake of virtue signalling, it's like a parody. Circlejerking was always a problem on Reddit, and likely will be on Ruqqus too, but the abusive moderation and admin intervention which suppresses anyone who steps out of line really has done a number on Reddit.
